intro: Silene keiskei f. keiskei, commonly known as the desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene keiskei f. keiskei plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
